summary:
New England is a region in the northeast U.S., made up of six states: Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, and Vermont. It has a rich history, starting with the Pilgrims' settlement in 1620. The area played a key role in the American Revolution, fighting for independence from Britain.

The geography is diverse, with coastal plains and Appalachian Mountains. Many towns are governed by town meetings, creating a unique local governance system. New England has a distinct cultural identity, blending various traditions and historical influences.
title: New England
